alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Lehigh; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 7:25PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lehigh, southeastern Carbon and west central Northampton Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 725 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Neffs, or 9 miles south of Lehighton, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lehighton, Northampton, Palmerton, Jim Thorpe, Slatington, Walnutport, Neffs, Coffeetown, New Tripoli, Berlinsville, Jordan Valley, Emerald, Beersville, Schnecksville, Claussville, Coplay, Bowmanstown, Parryville, Weissport and Weissport East. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 59 and 77. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for eastern and northeastern Pennsylvania.
